result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L Hockett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
AS OF 4/29/2015: Extended Supervision amended to 3 years.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA WAIVED based on the date of violation.

 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within 3 business days at the Waukesha Co. Sheriff's Dept.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time (nonworking hours) Standard release conditions.
Sentence may be transferred to Jefferson County. No electronic monitoring allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse L Hockett

records.addlTxt: Discharge of probation - satisfied - paid

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated April 23, 2015 filed by the Department of Corrections requesting clarification of the sentence.

Defendant Jesse L Hockett in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years)  Stayed for 4 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived based on the date of violation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - 45 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 04/13/2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Non working hours with standard release conditions. Sentence may be transferred to Jefferson County. No Electronic Monitoring allowed.
Sentencing hearing April 13, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.
